as an introductory offer CBOE isn't charging commission, but normally would. there is margin so you have a small amount of leverage (meaning you can deposit 44% of the price of a bitcoin and buy a future for a whole bitcoin). but if the price falls you will have to add more money

so bitcoin price is $16900 on CBOE reference (gemini). consider alice needs to pay Bob 1BTC in a month for some online work he's doing. she doesnt have BTC and is worried the price may go up, so she deposits $8000 and locks in the 1month price at $16900 (with margin).

6/ If you want your # cryptoasset to become a reserve asset, treat your community carefully. It is the loyalty and trust that could preserve your network value long term.

5/ It is the faith in preserved purchasing power (or increases in purchasing power) that will drive hodlers to hodl a # cryptoasset, hence pulling down velocity. Without that “faith” the velocity could skyrocket & value be crushed.
4/ Importantly, what will differentiate a reserve # cryptoasset from those that become hypercommoditized is velocity (i think).
3/ The “financial utility” of a reserve # cryptoasset could drive just as much value creation as the “real utility.” For # bitcoin this is clearest, but # ether already showing signs of this.
2/ These reserve # cryptocurrencies & # cryptocommodities will be the most trusted and widely used, allowing people to have faith in their continued preservation of purchasing power.
Just as some fiat currencies and physical commodities have become reserve assets, in the future we will have reserve # cryptocurrencies & # cryptocommodities.
